definition: sheng, a free reed wind instrument with vertical bamboo pipes

sentences.english: Home to know why, Shengge Water over the foreshore.
sentences.chinese: 何以知家給，笙歌滿水濱。

sentences.english: Wine, women, and song looked more attractive than plowing his father's fields.

definition: reed-pipe wind instrument and vertical bamboo flute
lit. to celebrate peace with songs and dance (idiom)/fig. to make a show of happiness and prosperity
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
to sing to a string accompaniment/education (a reference to teaching the people Confucian values by means of song in ancient times)
late at night/in the dead of night
the warbler sings and the swallow dances/prosperity abounds (idiom)
see 清風明月|清风明月[qing1 feng1 ming2 yue4]
romance/beautiful scenery/small or petty (of talk etc)
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
a beautiful woman/graceful and elegant posture/moon
